DOCNAME: KUDUMIJA v. BOSNIA AND HERZEGOVINA AND SERBIA AND REMENOVIĆ AND MAŠOVIĆ v. BOSNIA AND HERZEGOVINA
JUDGES: David Thór Björgvinsson;Ineta Ziemele;Ledi Bianku;Päivi Hirvelä;Paul Mahoney;Vincent A. De Gaetano
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants , Mr PERSON , Mr PERSON and Mr PERSON , are citizens of GPE and GPE who were born in DATE , DATE and DATE respectively , and live in GPE ( the first applicant ) and GPE ( the second and third applicants ) .

CARDINAL . The first and third applicants , who had been granted legal aid , were represented before ORG , a lawyer practising in GPE . The Government of GPE ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Deputy Agent , PERSON .
CARDINAL . The applicants served in the LAW , the armed forces of the former ORG ( “ the SFRY ” ) and retired before DATE .

CARDINAL . Their military pensions were assessed according to their rank and DATE of service , and were paid from ORG in GPE ( “ the ORG ” ) . Payments from that fund to JNA pensioners living in what is today GPE ( “ the Federation ” ) came to an end shortly after the outbreak of the DATE - CARDINAL war .

CARDINAL . From that time until LAW ( see below ) , it was unclear who was responsible for the payment of JNA pensions . However , in DATE GPE issued a decree establishing the right of JNA pensioners to receive pension from what later became GPE ( " LAW " ) in an amount corresponding to PERCENT of what would have been their JNA pensions . That provision was later incorporated in ORG DATE , which entered into force on DATE ( see paragraph DATE below ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE GPE , GPE , GPE ( succeeded in DATE by GPE ) , the former GPE and GPE signed LAW ( " LAW " ) , which entered into force on DATE . Under Annex E each successor ORG assumed responsibility for the regular payment of pensions to their citizens who had been civil or military employees of the former SFRY , irrespective of their current residence , if those pensions were financed from federal funds .

CARDINAL . NORP The fundamental rights of workers in the former SFRY with regard to pensions and social security were established in LAW CARDINAL § CARDINAL ) . That constitutional provision was implemented through ORG .

CARDINAL . Regulation of the pension system beyond the rules established in the SFRY law was the responsibility of the GPE , so each republic had its own pension legislation and public pension fund . In GPE pensions were governed by ORG . All employees , except for JNA personnel , paid into the pension fund of their republic of residence . This applied also to employees of the federal ministries and agencies . The pension funds in the republics worked closely together . If an individual worked and contributed to a pension fund in CARDINAL republic , he or she could choose to retire in a second republic and still receive his or her pension from the first republic ’s pension fund through the distribution system of the second republic . If an individual lived and worked , and therefore paid his contributions , in CARDINAL republic throughout his working life , upon retirement he was entitled to receive his pension from the fund to which he had contributed the most .

CARDINAL . NORP The pension rights of military personnel were regulated and secured through the federal authorities ( LAW . JNA military personnel paid their contributions to and received their pensions from ORG . This was the only pension fund existing at federal level .

CARDINAL . The Military Pension and Disability Insurance Act DATE regulated the specific aspects of military pensions . It provided for several mechanisms which rendered the treatment of JNA military pensioners more favourable than that of other groups . For example , in determining their entitlement to a pension , the Act generally credited JNA pensioners with DATE of service for DATE of actual service . Moreover , the amount of pension was based on the salary of DATE in active service , while for other groups it was based on the average salary of DATE with the highest income .

CARDINAL . Pursuant to LAW DATE LAW was transformed into ORG ( succeeded in DATE by GPE ; " ORG " ) . Under this Act ORG was supposed to continue the payment of JNA pensions . It is unclear , however , how that duty was discharged in practice ( whether residence in GPE and/or non - residence in CARDINAL of the former SFRY republics was a condition for those payments ) . However , ORG and , later , ORG continued to pay pensions to JNA pensioners living in what is DATE the PERSON throughout the DATE - CARDINAL war and afterwards . It would appear that this arrangement was based on an ad hoc agreement between ORG and GPE .
The facts of the cases , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
CARDINAL . NORP The applicant was in active military service in the JNA until DATE , when he retired . He received his pension from ORG until DATE .
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the applicant started receiving pension from what later became ORG , in an amount corresponding to PERCENT of what his JNA pension would have been .

CARDINAL . At the applicant ’s request , on DATE ORG issued a decision terminating the payment of the applicant ’s pension on the basis that he was receiving payments from ORG . It was confirmed that the applicant received his last pension from ORG in DATE .

CARDINAL . On several occasions the applicant went to ORG and asked about the full payment of his military pension . Each time he was informed that his right to a pension had been established by ORG and that , therefore , he could not make any direct claims against ORG , which only provided payment after ORG had stopped paying his pension .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant complained to ORG ( a domestic human - rights body set up under Annex DATE LAW ) about the impugned situation . On DATE , ORG dismissed the applicant ’s complaint ( together with those of CARDINAL other JNA pensioners ; see decision CARDINAL . CH/CARDINAL/CARDINAL et al ) as manifestly ill - founded , in line with its established case - law concerning JNA pensioners ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant asked ORG to clarify the status of JNA pensioners after the entry into force of LAW . On DATE ORG informed the applicant that it had taken steps to implement LAW , together with ORG of GPE . However , it did not provide any further information on the action taken .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant sought the same information from ORG of GPE , which transferred his request to ORG . On DATE the ORG informed the applicant that it did not have the power to apply directly the provisions of LAW and that , in the absence of new legislation on pensions , it would continue to apply the provisions of ORG DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE informed the applicant that all legislation concerning the pension system was made at Entity level ( each of ORG being an “ Entity ” ) .
CARDINAL . The applicant was in active military service in the LAW until DATE , when he retired . He received his pension from ORG until DATE .
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the applicant started receiving pension from what later became ORG in an amount corresponding to PERCENT of what his JNA pension would have been .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant asked ORG to pay his military pension . On DATE ORG responded that his right to a pension had been established by ORG and that , therefore , he could not make any direct claims against ORG , which only provided payment after ORG had stopped paying his pension .

CARDINAL . On an unknown date in DATE the applicant complained to ORG . On DATE ORG ( a legal successor of ORG ) dismissed the applicant ’s complaint ( together with those of CARDINAL other JNA pensioners ; see decision nos . CH/CARDINAL/CARDINAL et al ) as manifestly ill - founded , in line with its established case - law concerning JNA pensioners ( see paragraphs CARDINAL and CARDINAL below ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant asked ORG of GPE and GPE about the implementation of LAW concerning JNA pensions . ORG forwarded the request to ORG , which in turn informed the applicant on DATE that it did not have the power to apply directly the provisions of LAW and that in the absence of new legislation on pensions it would continue to apply the provisions of ORG DATE .
CARDINAL . The applicant was in active military service in the LAW until DATE , when he retired . He received his pension from ORG until DATE .
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the applicant started receiving pension from what later became ORG in an amount corresponding to PERCENT of what his JNA pension would have been .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant instituted proceedings before ORG ( " ORG " ) against ORG , seeking the payment of his military pension . On DATE ORG rejected his claim as unfounded . That decision was upheld on appeal by ORG and ORG on DATE and DATE respectively .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant instituted proceedings before ORG , requesting that DATE of service in the JNA be included in his pension records . On DATE ORG rejected his request . It explained that the applicant was registered with ORG , which established his right to a pension . That decision was upheld on appeal by the competent second - instance administrative body and ORG on DATE and DATE , respectively .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant asked ORG to pay his military pension in accordance with Annex E to LAW . On DATE the ORG informed him that it did not have the power to apply directly the provisions of LAW and that , in the absence of new legislation on pensions , it would continue to apply the provisions of ORG DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG and ORG informed the applicant that under LAW GPE , pension systems were legislated at Entity level and that , accordingly , ORG had adopted a decision on DATE establishing that the implementation of Annex E to LAW would be the responsibility of the Entities’ pension funds . ORG also stated that attempts had been made to resolve that issue at ORG level , but that the ORG had been unwilling to transfer pension matters to the ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant , together with CARDINAL other JNA pensioners , lodged an appeal before ORG , alleging that the ORG had failed to respect its obligation under LAW in violation of LAW , and LAW no . CARDINAL to the Convention .

In its observations submitted to ORG on DATE , ORG argued that Annex E did not specify the exact amount of pension to be paid to JNA pensioners . Consequently , by paying certain amounts under LAW DATE , ORG had complied with its obligation to JNA pensioners .

In their observations submitted to ORG on DATE , ORG argued that as CARDINAL of ORG it could not be held responsible for the implementation of LAW because the signatory party to it was GPE . They further argued that they had nevertheless taken steps in DATE to adjust the existing legislation in line with PERSON In particular , section CARDINAL of ORG had been amended so that JNA pensioners could receive payments from ORG irrespective of their place of residence and that those payments would be funded from the Entity budget ( paragraph CARDINAL below ) . The Government also argued that Annex E did not define the amount of JNA pensions to be paid by the successor GPE .

In his observations of DATE the Attorney General of GPE maintained that it was not in dispute that JNA pensioners’ right to a pension had been established under PERSON However , the question of the amount of pension fell to be regulated by the legislation of the ORG and not by LAW . He further proposed that the appeal be dismissed on non - exhaustion grounds as the plaintiffs had failed to use domestic remedies in the proceedings before ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the appeal on non - exhaustion grounds , holding that domestic remedies ( an appeal against the " silence of the administration " ) had not been exhausted in the proceedings before ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant submitted a request to ORG " ) for extraordinary judicial review of ORG decision of DATE ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) . On CARDINAL DATE ORG accepted the request , amended the decision of ORG of DATE by quashing the administrative decisions of DATE and DATE , and remitted the case to ORG for a re - trial . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s request . On DATE he appealed against that decision . It would appear that those proceedings are still pending .
IV . RELEVANT DOMESTIC LAW AND PRACTICE
CARDINAL . The LAW of GPE ( Annex CARDINAL to ORG for Peace ) entered into force on DATE . In accordance with LAW , GPE and GPE consists of QUANTITY Entities : ORG and PERSON .

LAW establishes the matters that are the responsibility of the institutions of GPE . It also provides that all governmental functions and powers not expressly assigned in the LAW to the institutions of GPE will be those of the Entities . The pension system is not among the matters listed in that Article .
Under LAW ( a ) of LAW , the Entities have the right to establish special parallel relationships with the neighbouring GPE consistent with the sovereignty and territorial integrity of GPE .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of ORG DATE of the Federation , which entered into force on DATE , provides that JNA pensioners who were citizens of GPE and GPE and resident in the GPE would receive pension in an amount corresponding to PERCENT of what their JNA pensions would have been . Section CARDINAL was amended on CARDINAL DATE so that JNA pensioners could receive payments from ORG irrespective of their place of residence , and that those payments would be funded from the Entity budget .

CARDINAL . ORG delivered its first decision concerning JNA pensioners on DATE ( see PERSON and others , nos . PERSON . The Chamber held that the applicants’ right to the peaceful enjoyment of their possessions under LAW No . CARDINAL to the Convention had not been violated and that they had not been discriminated against in the enjoyment of their right to social security under LAW .
The reasons were set out in the decision , the relevant part of which reads as follows :

“ The ORG notes that the applicants have not paid any contributions to the ORG in GPE , nor to any other pension fund in GPE or in the Federation . They had no legal relationship with the PIO BiH before the issuing of the DATE Decree on Pension and ORG during the State of War or Immediate Threat of War . Moreover , the competent authorities of the Federation do not have access to the employment record of the former JNA personnel , so they would not be in a position to determine the entitlement of these pensioners and the amount to which they are entitled under provisions DATE different from Articles CARDINAL to CARDINAL – of ORG .

The ORG concludes that the applicants have no claims against the ORG or against the GPE beyond those attributed to them by the DATE Decree and CARDINAL Act which could be regarded as a possession under LAW No . CARDINAL to the Convention . The applicants’ claim against ORG , which is not at issue before the ORG , appears to remain untouched by the above - mentioned legislation . Accordingly , the ORG concludes that the applications do not reveal any interference with the applicants’ possessions by the GPE and , accordingly , do not reveal a violation of LAW No . CARDINAL to the Convention .

In the light of these considerations , the ORG concludes that the difference in treatment between JNA pensioners on the one hand and pensioners of the ORG of GPE and the ORG of the Federation on the other hand , including former JNA members who served in those armed forces , has an objective justification in that the members of the second group are former soldiers of the armed forces of the country or government whose pension fund is paying their pensions . As the applicants still receive a pension that is higher than the average pension paid by ORG , the ORG does not find that the Federation government exceeded its margin of appreciation in not extending the favourable treatment granted to its own pensioners to the JNA pensioners . The ORG thus considers that there is no discrimination of the applicants in the enjoyment of the right to social security in comparison with the military pensioners of either the ORG of GPE or ORG . "

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG delivered its decision in the case of PERSON and CARDINAL other JNA pensioners ( no . CH/CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) . It held that in ratifying LAW on DATE , GPE had assumed responsibility for the payment of JNA pensions . However , since the Succession Agreeement was not in force at the time , the applicants could not have had a claim against GPE that would constitute a protected possession within the meaning of LAW No . CARDINAL . The ORG went further to note that GPE and/or the GPE would have to enact legislation in order to make the obligation resulting from LAW operative and enforceable , once it entered into force .

CARDINAL . The Agreement on Succession Issues was the culmination of DATE of intermittent negotiations under the auspices of ORG on the former GPE and ORG ( appointed pursuant to LAW to ORG for Peace ) . It entered into force between GPE and GPE , GPE , GPE ( succeeded in DATE by GPE ) , the former GPE and GPE on DATE . LAW to the LAW , in so far as relevant , reads as follows :

" Each State shall assume responsibility for and regularly pay pensions which are due to its citizens who were civil or military servants of the SFRY irrespective of where they are resident or domiciled , if those pensions were funded from the federal budget or other federal resources of the SFRY ... "
